p: Panacis Japonici Rhizoma (PJR), derived from dry rhizome of Panax japonicus C. A. Meyer (Araliaceae), distributes in the southwest of China [ 66â€“68]. As a widely used focal medicine, the PJR manifested similar clinical merits in anti-tussive and anti-inflammatory diseases [ 69, 70]. Recently, Chen et al. [ 71] have demonstrated that PJR could suppress the HEY and A2780 cells migration and invasion by decreasing the Cdc42 and Rac activities.
